New: Clothoid transitions (Euler spirals) at the entry and exit of every curve — curvature now ramps in and out smoothly instead of jumping straight to full arc radius
Hairpin merging: overlapping rounded corners now resolve into a single clean hairpin shape instead of breaking
Custom curvature mode rebuilt with speed-driven geometry — arcs widen at higher design speeds and tighten at lower ones
B-Spline elevation interpolation for smoother grade transitions along the vertical alignment
Axis-lock point editing — lock movement to a single axis when adjusting a placed point
Hold right-click to place road points as an alternative to left-click
Distance readout in the plotting dock showing total road length while placing points
Expandable warning messages with a pin highlight showing exactly which point is causing a tight-curve issue
All docks unified under a dark charcoal theme with animated status banners and warning rows
Help dock completely redesigned — tabbed layout with pages for Workflow, Terminology, Warnings, Road Styles, and Credits
Changelog tab in Help showing live version status from GitHub, with a configurable refresh cooldown
Improved: Superelevation transitions are smoother and more consistent — overlapping zones now blend instead of producing a crease, and reversals on S-curves begin earlier
Banking amplitude increased so road lean is more visible at typical design speeds
Unsaved changes indicator in Road Styles so it's always clear when your settings haven't been applied yet
Fixed: Crash when clicking an existing road in the world to start a new one
Selection highlights lingering on roads after entering or exiting an edit mode
Road Styles section blockers pushing content down instead of overlaying it

New: Point-and-click road placement — click points in the world to define the alignment, with a live curve preview as you plot
Point editor — drag placed points with 3D handles to refine the path after initial placement
Road Styles dock — save and load road configurations so settings can be reused across builds
Road connector — snap a new road onto the end of an existing one to continue an alignment
